Figure 3:Patching schemes group bytes in different ways, each leading to a different number of resulting patches.
Since each patch is processed using a large transformer step, the number of patches directly determines the bulk of the compute expended in terms offlops.
These schemes group bytes into patches by (a) striding every four bytesÂ (Â§2.1) as in MegaByte(Yu etÂ al.,2023), (b) tokenizing with Byte-Pair Encoding (bpe), in this case the Llama-3(Dubey etÂ al.,2024)tokenizer, (c & d) entropy-based patching as in this workÂ (Â§2.3), (e) patching on space-bytes(Slagle,2024), (f) and patching on entropy using a small CNN byte-level model with 2-byte context.
